subject: Re: [junit] Test Everything, No Matter How Simple
msgSnippet: ... This is generally what happens in the real world. ... Agreed. ... Nope. You sound realistic to me. I argue on the side of 100% unit test coverage, but
messageBody:
On 8/23/06, Jason Rogers <jacaetevha@...> wrote:
> Perhaps I have a warped sense of high-test-coverage but I have always taken
> it to mean
>
> ³covering all of the most likely cases and even most of the unlikely
> cases²

This is generally what happens in the real world.

> not just
>
> ³one test per unit².

Agreed.

> With this definition I would assume that approaching 100% is possible, but
> getting 100% is improbable. In my 7+ years of unit testing, test-first, and
> TDD I have never developed a system in which I would be confident saying I
> had 100% test coverage. Maybe I am too much of a skeptic.

Nope. You sound realistic to me. I argue on the side of 100% unit test
coverage, but while that is my target, I realise that real life will
most likely interfere and I will get less than that. It's still the
only worthwhile target aiming at though.

Simon

--
www.simonpeter.org
